From left to right : D.Otgonbayar, D.Ganbayar, N.Naranbaatar, D.TÃ¶mÃ¶rtsog. | Studio = 6 | Live = 1 | Video = 2 | Option = 1 | Option name = Compilation albums }} This is a discography of the Mongolian heavy metal band [[Hurd (band)|Hurd]]. == Studio albums == === The Best Collection I === {{Infobox album | Name = The Best Collection I | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Hurd (band)|Hurd]] | Cover = | Released = 1997 | Recorded = c. early 90s, Sonor Studio, [[Ulan Bator]], [[Mongolia]] | Genre = [[Heavy metal music|Heavy metal]] | Length = 62:15 }} '''''The Best Collection I''''' is Hurd's debut album. Recorded between the years of 1993-1995, and released along with'' [[Hurd discography#The Best Collection II|The Best Collection II]]'', it is considered to be one of the first heavy metal albums in Mongolian music history. It contains such hit songs as ''ChimeegÃ¼i irekh durlal'', ''Saikhan bÃ¼sgÃ¼i'' and ''Eejdee'', which are hugely popular among Mongolian music lovers, and are frequently included in the live set. 5 songs from ''The Best Collection I'' were re-arranged and played acoustically during the 1998 [[Unplugged (Hurd album)|Unplugged]] concert. Hurd released their first [[music video]] for ''Chono'', where the band is seen playing the song near an abandoned factory. It also contains numerous battle scenes from a 1945 movie about [[Choghtu Khong Tayiji|Tsogt Taij]]. It is told that the band members grew quickly tired and behaved impatiently during the filming, as they were not yet familiar with the process. Mongolian traditional music instruments were used for the recording of ''Bakharkhal'', most notably the [[Morin khuur]]. This song is among the first in a long list of patriotic songs written by Hurd. keyboards * Kh.Bayarbold - technician * A.Bayarmagnai - technician ---- === The Best Collection II === {{Infobox album | Name = The Best Collection II | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Hurd (band)|Hurd]] | Cover = | Released = 1997 | Recorded = early to mid 90s, Sonor Studio, [[Ulan Bator]], [[Mongolia]] | Genre = [[Heavy metal music|Heavy metal]] | Length = 59:27 }} '''''The Best Collection II''''' is Hurd's second studio album. It was recorded and released in conjunction with [[Hurd discography#The Best Collection I|The Best Collection I]], and as a result the two albums are sometimes seen together as a double album. Compared to its counterpart, the style and lyrical theme of ''The Best Collection II'' is somewhat darker (dealing with night, darkness, fear, cemetery, ...), and the songs are rather fast paced, with ''Khar darsan zÃ¼Ã¼d'' being one of the fastest songs in Hurd's repertoire. The hugely successful ''Tsergiin bodol'' ("Soldier's Thoughts") is considered a classic and allowed the band to reach celebrity. The song was written by [[Dambyn Ganbold]], while he was in military service, his fellow soldiers helping him up on the lyrics. {{cite web | url = http://www.olloo.mn/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=91004 | title = Ð.ÐÐ°Ð½Ð±Ð°ÑÑ : Ð¦ÑÑÐ³Ð¸Ð¹Ð½ Ð±Ð¾Ð´Ð¾Ð» 30 Ð½Ð°Ñ ÑvÑÐ»ÑÑ | publisher = www.olloo.mn | language = Mongolian | accessdate = 2009-10-11 }} It is told that, during a performance in an all-star concert, Hurd had a 3 song setlist that included ''Tsergiin bodol'', but under popular demand they ended up playing the song three times in a row. Other famous songs from the album include ''Baga nas'', ''Zurag shig bÃ¼sgÃ¼i'' and ''Nulimsaa tevch'ye''. Hurd's 1998 [[Unplugged (Hurd album)|Unplugged]] [[acoustic music|acoustic]] concert includes no less than 8 songs from ''The Best Collection II''. With a few modifications, the melody in "Sokhor Nomin" was later reused in 2001's "Ueg Sons" (from ''Myangan Jild Gants''. One of these concerts was recorded and released as '''''Unplugged'''''. The album features 8 songs from ''The Best Collection II'', 5 from ''The Best Collection I'' and 3 previously unreleased songs. ''Chamaig zorino'' is the only Hurd song written by singer D.TÃ¶mÃ¶rtsog. ''Eejdee Ã¶rgÃ¶kh duu'' is a well known mongolian [[folk song]]. Chamaig Zorino later made its way to 2010's [[#Khairyn Salkhi|Khairyn Salkhi]]. Ð¢Ð°Ð»Ð°ÑÑÐ°Ð»ÑÐ½ ÐºÐ¾Ð½ÑÐµÑÑ | Type = video | Artist = [[Hurd (band)|Hurd]] | Cover = | Released = June 26, 2009 | Recorded = [[SÃ¼khbaatar Square]], [[Ulan Bator]], [[Mongolia]], July 11, 2005 | Genre = [[Heavy metal music|Heavy metal]] | Length = 1:31:56 }} '''''Talarkhalyn Kontsert''''' or "The Gratitude Concert" was one of Hurd's biggest outdoor shows, which took place at the [[SÃ¼khbaatar Square]] on [[Naadam]] day. It was a free concert celebrating the band's 10th anniversary, held before a crowd of 80,000 to 100,000 people, {{cite web | title = Ð¥ÑÑÐ´ÑÐ½ ÑÐ°Ð»Ð°ÑÑÐ°Ð»ÑÐ½ ÐºÐ¾Ð½ÑÐµÑÑ | url = http://www.olloo.mn/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=13053 | publisher = www.olloo.mn | language = Mongolian | accessdate = 2010-03-07 }} which is a record for Mongolia. [[Backing vocalist|backing vocals]] ---- == Compilation albums == === The Best Collection III === {{Infobox album | Name = The Best Collection III | Type = [[Compilation album]] | Artist = [[Hurd (band)|Hurd]] | Cover = | Released = 2001 | Recorded = Chugu Studio, RITM Studio, [[Ulan Bator]], [[Mongolia]] | Length = 56:54 }} '''''The Best Collection III''''' is a compilation album by Hurd, composed of various previously unreleased songs, except ''Shine jil'', which appears on [[Hurd discography#Myangan Jild Gants|Myangan Jild Gants]]. ''Ekh oron'' features late B.Damchaa, a famous mongolian actor. ''Khamag Mongol'' features pop singer [[Sarantuya]] and former [[Chingis Khaan (band)|Chingis Khaan]] singer D.Jargalsaikhan.
